ğŸ“ Challenge Instructionsïƒ

ğŸš€ Countering MDM Narratives in Your Fieldïƒ

Overviewïƒ

Over the next two weeks, you will conduct an in-depth analysis of a mis-, dis-, or malinformation (MDM) narrative that directly impacts your field of work or area of interest. This challenge will equip you with the analytical and strategic skills to assess, quantify, and counteract MDM threats in your professional domain. Your project will consist of three key components:

  1. MDM Narrative Analysis â€“ Identify and break down a real-world MDM campaign, event, or piece of news that went viral.

  2. Data Analysis Application â€“ Use data analytics techniques from the course to assess any of the following: narrativeâ€™s reach, engagement, sentiment, amplification networks, or impact on public perception, policy, or business decisions. This can include tracking how misinformation spreads on social media, identifying key amplifiers, or evaluating audience reactions.

  3. Mitigation Strategies â€“ Develop real-world, profession-specific solutions to counteract the identified MDM narrative. Your strategies should focus on enhancing resilience within your industry, whether through policy recommendations, media literacy initiatives, cybersecurity protocols, or strategic communication approaches.

You will choose one of three deliverable formats for your final submission:
ğŸ“Š Jupyter Notebook (Technical Analysis)
ğŸ“„ Written Report (Policy/Analytical Approach)
ğŸ“¢ PowerPoint Presentation (Executive Briefing Style)

This challenge is designed to ensure that your final deliverable is directly applicable to your career, providing a professional-grade analysis that can inform decision-making, risk assessments, or counter-MDM initiatives within your field.

ğŸ“… Challenge Timeline (2 Weeks)ïƒ

Week 1: Research & Data Collectionïƒ

  • Day 1-2: Select an MDM narrative relevant to your field.

  • Day 3-5: Gather data (social media posts, news coverage, reports).

  • Day 6-7: Conduct exploratory analysis (for Jupyter) or structure key points (for written/PPT versions).

Week 2: Analysis, Insights, and Finalizationïƒ

  • Day 8-10: Deep dive into analysis, refine insights, and draft key findings. - Day 11-12: Develop counter-MDM strategies based on your findings.

  • Day 13-14: Finalize and polish your deliverable for submission.

ğŸ” Core Components of the Challengeïƒ

Regardless of the format you choose, your project must include the following sections:

1ï¸âƒ£ MDM Narrative Analysisïƒ

  • Select an MDM narrative relevant to your profession or industry.

  • Provide background:

    • Who is spreading it? (Actors, bots, media sources, governments, or individuals?)

    • What is its goal? (Political influence, economic disruption, public confusion?)

    • Who is most affected by it? (Consumers, government agencies, security professionals, business sectors?)

  • Use an analytic framework to assess the narrative:

    • NATOâ€™s 4D model: Detect, Deter, Defend, Document

    • The ABC Framework: Actor, Behavior, Content

2ï¸âƒ£ Data Analysis Applicationïƒ

  • Apply at least one data analytics technique from the course.

  • Possible approaches:

    • Social media analysis (How is the narrative spreading? Who is amplifying it?)

    • Sentiment analysis (What emotions are driving engagement?)

    • Engagement analysis (How does the public reactâ€”outrage, misinformation sharing, or debunking?)

    • Network analysis (Who are the key influencers, bots, or organizations behind the narrative?)

  • Use at least one dataset (social media trends, news reports, government data, or open-source intelligence).

  • Present findings through data visualization (network graphs, sentiment charts, trend analysis, etc.).

3ï¸âƒ£ Career-Focused Actionable Mitigation Strategiesïƒ

  • Propose specific counter-strategies that can be implemented in your field.

  • Your mitigation approach should be applicable to your industry:

    • For government/military/security professionals: Policy recommendations, intelligence briefings, risk assessments.

    • For corporate/public relations/media professionals: Strategic communication plans, misinformation response playbooks.

    • For researchers/data professionals: Tools for detecting misinformation, network monitoring systems.

  • Discuss potential obstacles and feasibility of your solution.

ğŸ¯ Choose Your Deliverable Formatïƒ

Select one of the following formats for your final submission:

ğŸ“Š Option 1: Jupyter Notebook (Technical Analysis)ïƒ

For those who want to showcase hands-on data skills.

âœ… Expectations:

  • Structured notebook with markdown sections explaining your methodology and findings.

  • At least 2â€“3 visualizations (network graphs, sentiment charts, bar charts, etc.).

  • Well-commented code for reproducibility.

  • Final markdown summary of key takeaways and mitigation strategies.

ğŸ¯ Evaluation Criteria:

  • Data-driven insights.

  • Technical correctness.

  • Clarity and effectiveness of visualizations.

ğŸ“„ Option 2: Written Report (Policy/Analytical Approach)ïƒ

For those who prefer a structured, narrative-heavy analysis.

âœ… Expectations:

  • A 3-5 page professional report with sections on context, analysis, and recommendations.

  • Must reference real-world sources and datasets.

  • Includes at least one data visualization to support findings.

  • Policy-oriented conclusions applicable to national security, international relations, or public policy.

ğŸ¯ Evaluation Criteria:

  • Depth of analysis.

  • Integration of real-world examples.

  • Logical flow and clarity.

  • Feasibility of proposed mitigation strategies.

ğŸ“¢ Option 3: PowerPoint Presentation (Executive Briefing Style)ïƒ

For those preparing to brief decision-makers.

âœ… Expectations:

  • 10-12 slide deck designed to brief an executive, military, or policy audience.

  • Key insights distilled into visuals and bullet points.

  • Recorded voiceover or detailed speaker notes.

ğŸ¯ Evaluation Criteria:

  • Clarity of messaging.

  • Visual effectiveness.

  • Strategic insights and real-world applicability.

ğŸ’° Why This Challenge is Worth Your Timeïƒ

This challenge ensures you leave the course with a professional, real-world asset that you can use in your career by:

âœ… Applying data analytics techniques to a relevant security, business, or policy issue.
âœ… Tailoring your work to your professionâ€”government, intelligence, corporate security, communications, or research.
âœ… Creating a presentation, report, or notebook that can be used for future career discussions.
âœ… Developing practical counter-MDM strategies for real-world implementation.
